# Part 1: command-line bullshittery

```{bash}
#CREATE DIRECTORY FOR GIT REPO
cd ~
pwd

rm -rf ps2_repo # force remove directory (if it exists)
mkdir ps2_repo
cd ps2_repo
pwd

#INITIALIZE GIT REPO
echo "" # this is just creating blank line in output
git init
ls -al

mkdir scripts
mkdir plots

#create ps2 r script
cd scripts
echo "#Problem set 2 R script" >> ps2_script.R
echo "#Line 2, Problem set 2 R script" >> ps2_script.R

cat ps2_script.R

git status
```
